alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Harvey; Marion; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:10AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Sedgwick, eastern Harvey, Chase, northwestern Butler and southeastern Marion Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 410 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Burdick to near Garden Plain. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Newton, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Goddard, Rose Hill, Maize, Clearwater, Marion, Sedgwick, Towanda, Colwich and Peabody. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 32. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 34 and 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for central and east central Kansas.
